Articles.Content:
I have been trying to reach the altitude of 100KM as fast as possible.

So far I have made it in 2min 49sec with final velocity just bit under 3200m/s.

So, I want to challenge you, my fellow gamers, to try and reach altitude of 100KM as fast as possible, with final velocity over 4000m/s.

I have used the Sunday Punch's Wobbly rockets mod, v. 1.08.

Extra stylepoints will be awarded for usage of basic parts only ;P

Attached: My best ship so far

Did two runs in 2m 38s and 2m 39s. Difference in times due to manual control during liftoff... my dragster isn't exactly stable in the first stage with just one SAS. Which is also why I think my time is probably easy to beat with a more stable rocket.

I used basic parts only and my end speed was 1966 m/s just a second or so before reaching 100 km altitude.

Engine parts used:

4x Liquid Engine

4x Liquid Fuel Tank

21x Solid Fuel Booster

1st Stage: 12x Solid Fuel Boosters

2nd Stage: 9x Solid Fuel Boosters + 3x Liquid Engines

3rd Stage: 1x Liquid Engine
Run it again without the parachute (does it have mass?) and controlled the craft a little better at launch, the time was 2m 37s with a final speed of 2143 m/s.
1minute, 5 seconds on a single tank of gas and a pair of E1000s. Hit 3.5km/s at burnout

my best time so far is 1 minute 4 seconds and i think i can beat it, trying one more idea then i'll post pictures and ship info as proof.

ok heres the latest one i've done..

1 SAS mod

1 decouplers

1 XL fuel tank

1 5x1 coupler

5 necelle engines

starting image:

as close to 100km as i could get with the image:

images changed to reflect my new time..

new time: 58 SECONDS to get to 102KM!!!!!

old time: 1 minute 3 seconds to hit 101KM.

http://i.imgur.com/JeyUm.png

http://i.imgur.com/TtU9P.png
So what can you guys do with stock parts?

So what can you guys do with stock parts?

lol i'd rather not embarrass myself i really suck with the stock stuff plus i can't even remember what all the stock parts are.

Having all these interstellar-mods kind of defeats the purpose...

I would like to get my ass kicked by some Wobbly rocket guy!

Or someone with stock parts, that would be even better! (Ok, Exel already beat my time, but not the velocity!)

WANT MOAR SPEED! >

Having all these interstellar-mods kind of defeats the purpose...

I would like to get my ass kicked by some Wobbly rocket guy!

Or someone with stock parts, that would be even better! (Ok, Exel already beat my time, but not the velocity!)

WANT MOAR SPEED! >

lol i know, i tried with the stock parts, seriously about to pull my hair out because i can't get anything to friggin fly straight!!!!!

i'll try with all wobbly rocket parts next after i calm down..

Run it again without the parachute (does it have mass?) and controlled the craft a little better at launch, the time was 2m 37s with a final speed of 2143 m/s.

'chute has a mass of 0.3.

just got into the game today, and found your thread...

on stock parts was able to hit 100,822m in 2min 25sec, with a highest speed achieved of 2095m/s

I used Wobbly parts again and this improved SAS http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=1396.0

And I made new personal record! I did it in 2m 4s, with final velocity of bit over 3000m/s :w00t:

Ok, time was improved a lot, but WANT MOAR SPEED! >

EDIT:

By optimizing the stages I managed to squeeze couple more seconds off: 1m 57s, with final velocity of 3080 m/s.
how about this, add another part to it. no SAS modules. that'll make it much more tricky.
Stock parts, no SAS.

Stock parts, no SAS.

Nice! Can you attach your ship or tell what parts you used, stages etc?

edit:

Just did it in 1m 47s, final velocity 2263m/s

Nice! Can you attach your ship or tell what parts you used, stages etc?

Pod, LFT, LFE, decoupler, tricoupler, LFT, LFE.

bested my last time...

stock parts hit 100549m, in 2min 16sec, 2219m/s highest speed
1 min 14 seconds to 100k 1 min 22 to 144 final velocity 4751.9 m/s
2:09 and 2498.6m/s stock parts only:

To be sure non-stock in this competition doesn't impress me. I dove into the .cfg files and shaved down my time from just over 2 minutes to around 1 minute. The only limiting factor was keeping my rocket from ripping apart from the acceleration. Some of the non-stock parts are essentially cheats with nice textures. I honestly don't mind them, but in a competition like this they really can throw things askew.
I did 2:12 with just two liquid tanks and 6 SRBs strapped to the side. I'd like to see if we can beat 2 minutes with stock parts only.

Just did it in 1m 47s, final velocity 2263m/s

Any hints on how?

I can hit about 2:03 using 5 fuel tanks through 3 engines, plus 9 SRBs

Any hints on how?

I can hit about 2:03 using 5 fuel tanks through 3 engines, plus 9 SRBs

My design evolved to approximately this, and I got 2:04. The craft is impressively difficult to launch.

2:08 if I remove a LFT and put 3 more SRBs on the bottom.

~100682 in 2:02, stock parts only. Max speed 2348.1 m/s 8)

Edit: tweaked a few things and shaved off a second - ~100437 in 2:01, stock only. Max speed 2346.7 m/s
